title: Catene ideali con numero fissato di auto-intersezioni
abstract:
In this thesis we study in detail the self-intersection properties of Random
Walks. Although notoriously hard to tackle, these properties are crucially
related to the excluded-volume effect and other central features of real
polymers. Our main purpose will be to study ideal chains (Random Walks) on
lattice where the ratio between the number of self-intersections and the total
length is fixed to some number.
